text: Happy Friday! I dropped an episode with Natalie Severino who leads Marketing at Chorus. We cover building teams, sales alignment, and how content plays a role in creating internal synergy. You can follow link or listen to the 3C Podcast wherever you consume fine audio content. :headphones: <https://www.thejuicehq.com/blog/3c-podcast-episode-being-a-marketer-with-a-bias-for-sales-with-natalie-severino-of-chorus>

attachments.title: 3C Podcast Episode: Being a Marketer with a Bias for Sales with Natalie Severino of Chorus| The Juice
attachments.text: We are on a mission to provide value to B2B content marketers abound. Rewind the VHS version of your content strategy. Let us help you deliver the Netflix experience.

text: I have often found solace in Camus' writings :heart:

elements.text: I have often found solace in Camus' writings

text:
At least, one brand new SaaS company joins the pool of existing software companies in the world every day, according to Crunchbase.

On Capterra, there are over *700 software categories*.

The same scenario is also playing out on G2, a popular software review website.

The fact is…

The SaaS business model is becoming more popular. 

Hence, the competition for audience attention and sales will never remain the same.

In fact, there’s a SaaS product for anything you can think of, as we speak.

From popular categories such as CRM software, project management software, marketing automation software, and so on. 

To less known categories such as church software, dental practice software, massage therapy software, pawnshop software, etc.

If you’re a SaaS business owner or marketer, you should rethink how you market your software to your target audience through SaaS content writing. 

Else, the competition out there will consume you.

In my latest post, I share with you the exact process for writing SaaS content that generates high-quality traffic, increases user signups, and impacts your MRR and ARR.

After reading this guide, you’ll learn:

:point_right: 8 types of content you should be writing for your SaaS business
:point_right: Examples of SaaS companies using these content types to grow
:point_right: How you can implement the same for your SaaS brand.

Click the link below to read the piece now:

<https://yourcontentmart.co/saas-content-writing/>

attachments.title: SaaS Content Writing | A Complete Step-by-Step Guide
attachments.text: In this SaaS Content Writing guide, you'll learn how to create SaaS content that generates high-quality traffic, drive conversions, and increase user signups for your SaaS brand.
attachments.fallback: Your Content Mart: SaaS Content Writing | A Complete Step-by-Step Guide
